(2010) }} "'''You Know Me'''" is the second official [[single (music)|single]] from [[British people|British]] singer-songwriter [[Robbie Williams]]' eighth studio album ''[[Reality Killed the Video Star]]''. The song was released on December 4, 2009. It is based on an original song "VoilÃ " written by [[French people|French]] artist [[FranÃ§oise Hardy]]. Williams performed the song during his ''[[BBC Electric Proms]]'' concert on 20 October 2009. [[Ken Bruce]] premiered the song on [[BBC Radio 2]] during his show.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b00ncd9q/Ken_Bruce_23_10_2009/ |title= Ken Bruce plays ''You Know Me'' for the first time on his Radio 2 show |publisher=BBC |date= |accessdate=2009-10-26}} ==Track listing== ; UK CD Single # "You Know Me" â 4:21 # "[[Bodies (Robbie Williams song)|Bodies]]" (Aeroplane Remix) â 6:42 ; Digital EP # "You Know Me" â 4:21 # "You Know Me" ([[The Count & Sinden]] Remix) â 4:58 # "You Know Me" ([[The Count & Sinden]] Dubble Bubble Remix) â 4:15 ==Critical reception== UK website [[Digital Spy]] gave the song four stars (out of five) commenting that: "''You Know Me'', a single whose very title seems to be cosying up to all those fans he's neglected in recent years - just the sort of fans who are likely to enjoy this tune. Borrowing sufficiently from FranÃ§oise Hardy's ''Voila'' to earn the chanteuse a co-writing credit, it's a classic Robbie ballad with lashings of strings, 'shoo-ba-ba' backing vocals and a lovely, timeless-sounding chorus melody."{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/singlesreviews/a187125/robbie-williams-you-know-me.html |title=Music - Singles Reviews - Robbie Williams: 'You Know Me' |publisher=Digital Spy |date=2009-11-17 |accessdate=2009-11-22}} ==Music video== The music video for the song was released on Williams' official website on 6 November 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.robbiewilliams.com/news-blogs/watch-you-know-me-video/ |title= Watch You Know Me Video|publisher=RobbieWilliams.com |date= |accessdate=2009-11-06}} In the video Robbie Williams falls asleep and wakes up dressed as a rabbit in a waistcoat, exploring a fantasy world that seems to be based on ''[[Alice's Adventures in Wonderland|Alice in Wonderland]]''. After he finishes exploring the fantasy world he dances with a group of women also dressed as rabbits; however, this time he is wearing make-up to complete his transformation. The video was directed by Phil & Olly (also known as Diamond Dogs) and filmed at [[Shepperton Studios]]. ==Chart performance== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Chart (2009) !Peak
